intro: Anaphalioides bellidioides, commonly known as the bellidium-like anaphalioides, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of yellow or white. The plant has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, wind-dispersed seeds. It is native to regions of southern Europe and is often found in dry, rocky habitats. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
